messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people from different areas. This is because they did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight in a battle. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates the core vocabulary rule. The words 'punish' and 'battle' are B1 level and are unacceptable. The goal is to use vocabulary the A2 learner already knows, not to introduce new B1 terms. Additionally, the text omits the key factual detail that the children are chosen 'by lottery', which is a factual inaccuracy. The simple sentence structure is correct, but cannot compensate for these fundamental errors.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show people what happens when they do not follow the rules. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area by lottery. This means their names are picked by chance. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text is a strong attempt at simplification but violates the core vocabulary rule. The word 'chance' is B1 level. It is used in the sentence 'This means their names are picked by chance.' This is an unacceptable deviation from the A2 standard. An A2-level explanation is required. For example: 'This means luck decides the names.' Additionally, the passive voice 'are picked' is borderline. An active construction would be simpler and therefore better for this level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show people what happens when they do not follow the rules. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. Luck decides who they choose. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The word 'decides' is B1 level. An A2 text cannot contain B1 vocabulary. Replace it. For example: 'Luck says who they choose.' The sentence 'The government uses the games to show people what happens when they do not follow the rules' is structurally too complex for A2, containing multiple clauses. It must be broken into simpler, declarative sentences.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to control the people. This is because people did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose the children by luck. The children are 12 to 18 years old. The chosen children are called 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who must fight in the games. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates the strict A2 vocabulary rule. The word 'control' is B1 level. An A2 text must exclusively use A2 vocabulary. Instead of 'control the people', use an A2 phrase like 'show the people they are strong' or 'make the people afraid'. While the sentence structure is appropriately simple for A2, this vocabulary error is a critical failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show people it is strong. This is because people did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose the children by luck. The children are 12 to 18 years old. The chosen children are called 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who must fight in the games. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The sentence 'The chosen children are called 'tributes'' uses the passive voice ('are called'), which is too complex for a strict A2 standard. An active structure is required. For example: 'They call the chosen children 'tributes''. Additionally, the phrase 'to show people it is strong' is a factual simplification that alters the original meaning. The original text specifies the games are a 'punishment', not just a show of strength.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people. This is because people did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. The children are 12 to 18 years old. They call these children 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who must fight in the games. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text uses the word 'punish', which is B1 level. An A2 text must not use vocabulary above its level. Rephrase using A2 concepts, for example: 'The government uses the games to show people what happens when they do not follow the rules.' Additionally, the text omits the key detail that the children are chosen 'by lottery'. This is a factual inaccuracy. The original information must be preserved.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show people what happens when they do not follow the rules. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area by lottery. This means the choice is by chance. The children are 12 to 18 years old. They call these children 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who must fight in the games. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.
Feedback received: Grade 10/10 - PASS

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of A2 simplification. Factual accuracy is maintained. Sentence structure is simple and declarative. Vocabulary is strictly A1/A2. The writer correctly identified the B2 word 'lottery' as essential and provided an immediate, simple A2-level definition ('This means the choice is by chance'). The keyword 'tributes' was also defined effectively. The B1 concepts of 'punished' and 'battle' were expertly rephrased using A2 vocabulary. No corrections are necessary.
